title: About me
content:
Hi, I’m Wenze Wu (吳汶澤), but you can also call me Esther. I’m an M.A. student in Linguistics at City University of Hong Kong.
My main research interests lie in Syntax and Semantics, with a particular focus on Control, wh-questions, and clause size.
At the moment, I’m applying for Ph.D. programs in Linguistics, and I hope to become a doctoral researcher in the near future. As a beginner in the field, I still have much to learn, and I look forward to exchanging ideas and learning from others.
If you are interested, feel free to check out my Data Judge project, where I regularly upload data links and invite everyone to help me with judgment tasks.
I aim to read at least one paper per week, and my Reading Journal is where I record my weekly reading notes. I warmly welcome discussions and feedback!
I also created a References section to keep track of the works I’ve collected. It’s not carefully categorized yet, but it might be useful as a resource (I hope my compilation does not involve any copyright issues, as I only organized the references without reproducing the original content.).
Finally, there’s a Message Board here. If you have thoughts and advice, please feel free to leave me a note. I’ll be very happy to hear from you.
In short, this space is both a study record and a way of connecting with others who share similar interests. I hope it grows with me as I learn more about linguistics.
